result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demerio D Day

records.addlTxt: The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 11/29/22.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court withholds decision on bail forfeiture.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Calendar call scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:50 am.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Demerio D Day in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demerio D Day appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.   Defendant waives In Person appearance; Matter live streamed on Dacast.
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2020 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed, Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights / Addendum
Received and Filed, Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance

Defendant Demerio D Day in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demerio D Day appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. 
Case scheduled for Initial Appearance. Defendant needs to connect with defense counsel. Defense requests adjournment. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned for Initial Appearance in branch 21. 
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/7e281253-5611-374f-1965-26b586969cf8  Initial appearance scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 09:40 am.
